3q4XRZYdnQIOqARD5rwtzw.text: I've only lived in London for six weeks and I've been here three times. It's my go to for great food and a family style restaurant with good customer service. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.

ND4OHvEqP90XF6_iqmvphQ.text: So, during my first two full nights in London I had take-away from two Indian restaurants that are literally right next door to each other and half-a-block from my place. I figure I should make them two of my first reviews, and might as well knock it out in a two-fer review. Here we go.The two places are The Rajadoot, with the prime corner position, weighing in at 3.5 stars on 2 reviews, and Bombay Spice coming in with 4.5 stars on a hefty 4 reviews. In short -- they both serve fine food, but so far I don't see what all the "London has the best Indian food in the world!!!111one!" fuss is about.With a one-full-star lead, and twice the review count, Bombay Spice easily won my business the first night. I was at first put off by the white table clothes, but upon further observation of the city I have determined that there must be a law here that requires all Indian restaurants have white table clothes. Once inside the feeling was relaxed, not pretentious, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.At Bombay Spice I decided to go with the tried and true Butter Chicken. It was obvious that the dish was made with love of quality ingredients, and I especially liked the addition of sliced almonds, but the spicing was too bland for my pallet. It was disappointing because the rice was so fragrant and appealing that I would guess that this place is not afraid to spice things appropriately. This might have been just a poor order, but it was listed on the "chef's suggestions" portion on the menu, so they do not get a pass.The next night I found myself hungry late night at 10:15PM on a Sunday, with just about everything in sight closed. After being rejected from a couple of other places I begrudgingly decided to go for Indian again. Obviously too embarrassed to go to the place I went the night before, I headed for Rajadoot and was happy to see the 3 bored staffers gaze upon me expectantly as I approached the door. It turns out they are open noon to midnight, 7 days a week, including holidays.At first I was going to play it safe again and order the Chicken Tikka Masala. But, after being upsold on an appetizer, I discussed Chicken Tikka Korai (which I had never had) with the waiter. He sold me on it primarily by saying it was "medium spicy". Remembering the rather bland Butter Chicken from the previous night I decided to switch things up I told him to change my order because I liked things very spicy. He replied: "If you like spicy that's a good choice, I things very spicy, but for you, medium spicy." To my disappointment, it turned out that I couldn't even detect the spiciness in the dish. And the appetizer was a bland fried shrimp. But, the flavors in the Korai were actually good, so if I could get it actually spicy maybe this place could earn an extra star.In the end, two more Indian restaurants that confirm my feelings on Indian food: meh -- 3 stars each.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. Dueling Indian
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom

rmmtOXOhua1ro-3J4gPWzA.text: Best authentic, healthy, and delicious Indian food! I've had it twice in one week! It was that good! The staff is very knowledgeable about their menu and ingredients! They have high quality meats, and fresh spices! I'll be back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan is a MUST! I had the chicken Tikka and the chicken curry! Both amazing, fresh, and made just how you request!

GpsQXktVzyFXPkUC7jofRw.text: Best curry house at Marleybone , 49 Paddington street London w1u 4hw. We went there for a lunch today to celebrate my best friends birthday .I took mix stater and Mon Mon murgh, which is chef special also my friend choose very hot Mr Naga chicken & Garlic naan is so soft and flavour so good. We enjoy nice evening with delicious curry . Staff are so friendly we definitely visit again when come to central London without doubt ..

T5SdKvaWtJwNQi-5u4lI6A.text: I wanted to update this review to let the restaurant know that I ended up having severe salmonella poisoning from the chicken curry I ate here, I spent a full week in the bathroom and in bed after this, ended up having to go to a private Urgent Care facility and pay almost 200 quid to have a fluid drip IV b/c I was so dehydrated and had low blood pressure.  Not to be dramatic but I literally thought I was dying, I was so weak, could barely get out of bed, and had family visiting at the time so couldn't enjoy my time with them as I couldn't get out of bed.  I couldn't eat anything for a week after this and ended up losing about 2.5 kg, after a week could only stomach fruit for about another week, and didn't eat meat for about a month after this, I don't think I ate chicken again for 5 months.  The experience was actually so bad that I haven't been able to eat Indian food since, which I used to love.   So i basically paid 130quid for a poisoned dinner and then an additional 200quid to care for my poisoning, and my family spent hundreds to visit and then not be able to spend time with me outside of my bedroom (except for the day we spent at the urgent care).  Never, never again.

099re4Mudk3-i8BjRCZNRA.text: Had wonderful service and good food! It was a nice sit down meal and very fresh. Had the balti chicken tikka masala and my husband had one of the lamb dishes. The lemon fried rice was my favorite!

Tnr_6NSWiezV7lWCpnXBXw.text: A charming corner restaurant with the nicest people and delicious food! The owner gave us warm personal attention, and the food was delicious and plentiful. A lovely place!

j4y4K1lk_3v2lM-IYEoiMA.text: Really enjoyed my meal here. Owners were fantastic as well. Naan and chicken tikka masala are top class. Will continue to go here as a regular.

veG6aIw7vtmf5q6ZUzRR-g.text: Great food with great owners in a great location. If you like authentic indian style cuisine they make everything fresh -- "fresh cook" as the owner calls it. I had okra, samosa, and a chef's special chicken. The chicken on the special was one of the best indian dishes I have ever had. The chef's special is Joypuri Murug - very tender chicken w their special recipe. Give it a try. Downstairs atmosphere looks better than upstairs, so don't be turned off by the small space!Location is great in a Marylebone, and it's quiet and comfortable inside.

bRfObk5ocX_Z6Xb7E9JPxw.text: The best Indian restaurant in the area. The dishes are always fresh and made from scratch, some of the best Indian I've tried. The staff are always accommodating and welcoming.

KrgY89RKtW8mfci6r3HoxA.text: I've been going to Rajdoot since I moved to the area in 1996 - it has become my default "go-to" Indian, consistently good food and excellent service without being pushy. Since I moved to the US a few years ago I don't get to dine there as often as I used to, but I make it a point to go there at least once every time I'm in London.Last went there on March 18 2016, and was a bit taken aback - there's new staff, much younger than previously, the balti didn't come in a little brass bucket and the pickles weren't in steel cruet. I had a momentary panic - new management can often spell the end for a good restaurant. Fortunately my fears were groundless. Talking to Ruben, the maitre d', it turns out that the original owners have taken well-deserved retirement and have turned the restaurant over to sons and nephews. The boys have changed a few things cosmetically, but the food is just as good as it ever was. The menu has changed a bit also, more prominence given to the Chef's Specials, but the balti (my favourite) is still top-notch, the pappadums are perfectly crisp without being excessively oily, and while the pickles are now in little ramekins they are just as I remember them. The service has become a little more attentive in terms of explaining dishes to people who might not be as familiar with the cuisine, but certainly not pushy. Great job, guys - keep up the excellent work! Looking forward to seeing you next time I'm in town!

G-zCAOT1VTEwBtdjmmpmsA.text: I would say by the review by Erica that she needs to get out more often.  The couple across from me said that their chicken was pink inside, and my meal was so-so.  They never brought my popadom, and the quality / quantity was questionable.  The waiter could not describe my dish in any detail so I guess I was taking a gamble.Much better Indian food in London.

GHtUHAyI2ugCa1lfZA_jXA.text: Best Indian restaurant in London. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very nice, clean, comfy seating. Had the vindaloo chicken with naan. Would definutely recommend for families or a date. Easy to find. Nice outdoor seating as well if the weather is good enough.  You would have a hard time finding a better value and quality!!

XlSoeh3PCD8UUcykdsymUQ.text: Absolutely was my favorite Indian place in London.  Right around the corner from my dorm and totally delicious!  The staff was always extremely friendly (although, like most Indian restaurants, they did tend to hover) and helpful with any food suggestions.  Try getting a seat in the downstairs dining room - the upstairs is a little smaller and you'll get a chill every time someone opens the door!My absolute favorite was their chicken karai - this is actually the restaurant at which I fell in love with this particular curry.  Always served with fresh, fluffy Naan and basmati rice.  So good!  Rajdoot is slightly pricey which threw me off, but the food is definitely delicious and makes the Rajdoot worth a visit!

Ic27epGnbQy5SP9ouJ2PWQ.text: The typical average Indian restaurant. Quite good food.Friendly service.Average price as well.

kcHtCdGFdH3CpvyNOHjURA.text: They are more concerned with grabbing people off the street then serving the people they have seated. The food was okay nothing amazing, but there was a hair in my food and that was pretty off putting.

vG42r5zro5qE1JtlmrtRRg.text: My wife and I were enjoying our honeymoon in London and decided to eat here as it was close to our hotel as well as Easter Sunday.  The food was absolutely amazing and the service only complemented our outstanding meal!  If you are in the area I highly recommend giving Rajdoot a try!

vEYMAhEp21y0D9AyksYw3g.text: We really liked that the menu had a lot of choices that were far from the routine choices at Indian restaurants.  Service was excellent as well.  We are visiting from California and really satisfied our "London Indian-food fix" we were looking for (it's better here).

30eEFtylK8zMK3pZ-ELs1g.text: We just arrived to the city and have been craving Indian food for a long time. We live on Maui so there aren't many options. We used Yelp to find a place close to our hotel. Our dining experience was great. The wait staff and management were very helpful and polite. The food was pretty amazing. Onion Bhaji was awesome. I've never had it before. Will again!  Lamb Bhuna was so perfect. I'm not a huge lamb eater but this was a winner. The star of the night was the Chicken Tikka Masala. Multiple layers of flavors. The best I've had. Would be a regular if we lived there.

4R_E2fiicfytlFKK2Gw5wQ.text: My wife, 3 princesses and I needed to have authentic Indian food while on our first trip to London. We were looking to eat somewhere that made us feel like locals. This restaurant and its owner made us feel like FAMILY. We had a table in the basement that was a little warm. As soon as they noticed that I was a little uncomfortable they quickly turned on the air conditioner. We ordered the dinner for 4 (£80) and a hot dish for me. Tons of food. Great variety and excellent service. Upon leaving the owner made a trip to the door to shake my hand and thank us for coming. We all loved this place!!

JLWtsNW7xyiH38CkI7Z_8Q.text: Delicious and authentic Indian food with extremely friendly and helpful staff. After the second time of coming, they remember you and treat you like family. Really enjoyed the eggplant side dish and the coconut chicken.

V1ouycwrs_FcVbf396GHFA.text: I wish I could just "ditto" Suzanne T's review.  What a wonderful experience.  This Indian food was just about the best I've ever had, but the friendliness of the staff was over the top great.  When you come here, listen to their recommendations.  I ordered Chicken Tikka, but they recommended the addition of vegetables (peppers and onions)....I never had it this way but it was WONDERFUL.   Also loved the mango chutney.  And the final price of the meal and drinks was VERY reasonable.

WuaBZjakQof-K0ONwJTtow.text: Just a wonderful experience! They even made waiting outside in 30 degree as pleasant as humanely possible.  They sat us, took our long coats, gave us drinks, took our food orders and treated us like long list friends.  The food was good too!

y7jQ86CgUWnXsJAXmdCZtg.text: We decided to try this restaurant based on good reviews and it did not disappoint.  It was busy but we were seated right away downstairs.  The space is a little tight but the atmosphere is bustling and friendly.  Everyone seems to be having a good time and expecting an excellent meal.  We had Kingfisher beer on tap.  The menu is full of tempting dishes and it was hard to decide what to order.  We had a stuffed Tomato starter... not crispy as described but it was stuffed with a delectable cheese and meat filling and we did like it very much.  Shared the Bahari Lamb, Malai chicken Tiki masala and chickpea and spinach side.  The lamb was so tender and flavorful would def. get again.  But the Chicken Tikki Masala was my favorite of the night...the rich fragrant sauce was heaven!  I will crave it forever and I will have to have it any time I come back to London.  The service was friendly and attentive.  Really an all-around Pleasant night and fabulous meal - highly recommended!

ps_irC06Y8_rn_jgH4CJXQ.text: Mediocre flavors - lack of spices and depth. Truly unforgettable. What IS memorable is unfortunately the service. Felt extremely rushed during the first 10 min. and uncomfortable with the constant battle of the overzealous hosts as they tried to lure in customers off the streets and away from their direct competitors right next door.

K2pQsQKES8A0TU_jHZe7Aw.text: Awesome. Amazing beautiful food and great service and amazingly affordable. Don't get tricked by the restaurant next door that tries to capture people on their way to Rajdoot. I don't know what they're called. But it should be obvious. At dinner time, they're empty and Rajdoot is full. They have a guy standing in front trying to hustle you in asking you if you want Indian food. Meanwhile, Rajdoot's people are busy serving their customers. Go to Rajdoot.

1VQSex2oxAucddrT3tnwgw.text: Longed for a curry and a quick search for near our hotel came up with the Rajdoot. Very glad we went for that one! Amazing food - make sure you go for the specials - one of the best I've had.

JO7IdgRBPgQ4Ms3xRXSPfg.text: Great people and delicious Indian food (my fav).  Been craving the coconut rice ever since.  Hussain took great care of me.  Wish this place were in my home town...

jFscgo6Dg2TjQ6y0ekrvmg.text: We saw it on Yelp and decided to try it. It was one of the best Indian meals we have ever had. Food was full of flavor and plentiful. The service was amazingly friendly and attentive. I would recommend it to anyone and we will definitely come back here.

ackYlKuamHoUNGUuC3Wg7A.text: Food was fabulous. Two of us. We had the starter selection for two. Two basic curries, a madras w. lamb and garlic w. chicken. One naan and two rice. Way too much! If there are two of you then the starter selection, one curry and either one rice or naan but not both would suffice. So we paid more than we should have. Came to 51+ GBP (which included 2 pints of lager). Would have been less than 40 had we known to order less. 4/5 only because the downstairs dining room isn't brilliant. But it hands down was the best meal we had during our 4 1/2 days in London. Ring and book and ask to be seated upstairs. You won't be disappointed.

KVQB0rjn7tXaZWYKX5Oqow.text: I wanted to like this place. They were open late and I was walking by and hungry. The gentlemen working there were extremely nice and friendly. However, the waiter tried to upsell me on my first choice (chicken tikka masala), stating they could not make that spicy. Um, really? I lived in LA my whole life where we have some pretty fantastic Indian food and that's never been a problem. Oddly enough (yes, I'm being cheeky), the tikka masala was 7.95 and he was recommending a dish that was 10.95. My spidy senses knew better and I stuck with the tikka masala.I got some lamb samosas and those were very tasty, although rather small. The tikka masala was  awful. It was way too sweet. Also, I had asked for mint chutney and they acted like they knew what I was talking about. Um, no. Absolutely, no. I was served a white sauce with a hint of green (mint?) in it. It was disgustingly sweet and awful. I will post a photo later. The papadam they gave me was good, but I had no chutney to complement it. So sad. I wish I could write a better review. I didn't touch the chicken- it is in my hotel refrigerator and even when I'm hungry I can't bring myself to try to eat any of it. Steer clear of this place unless you are just looking for some snack-sized samosas!

fX9h5norvDpzAoMTVwbCSw.text: It is my new favorite Indian Restaurant when I visit London.  Excellent food, very friendly and prompt service.

hBiq8W3QpzGoF_84aMC2SQ.text: Never ever get delivery or take away... Dining in is just ok, (tired, worn out, cramped, dirty dining roon), but to be fair- service is polite and timely. Take away and delivery is always flawed, at least it  has been for the past four times I have ordered from them (just a few blocks away). Only reason they get any stars at all- food is pretty good and in house service is polite. All that said, I will never patronize them again, too many other good Indian options around.

6lJqvWzj9GWExW4k21aYiw.text: I came here to experience the great Indian food London has to offer and I wasn't disappointed by the quality of the food. I would highly recommend the samasos. They came with an amazing sauce on the side that my friends and I all loved. The tikka masala was good too and the chicken balti was delicious and it comes with a side of naan. All of the portions were a pretty good size. 3 friends and I split 2 dishes with a side of vegetables and a side of rice and we were all full. The waiter tried really hard to upsell, so beware of that. Overall, the service was pretty slow and the upselling was very annoying, but the food was delicious.

iwWm9MHf0tzetONm4D3QFg.text: Since it this place is only a block from my university, I decided to give it a shot. The best part about the meal was definitely the guys who worked there. I was dining alone and they gave me a five star experience. Took my jacket and scarf, shook my hand and introduced themselves, answered all of my questions, made food suggestions and even ended the meal with a hot leon towel and a piece of chocolate.The food was pretty good. I ordered the chicken tikka massala and the waiter talked me into the chef's version of it. I asked for it to be a little spicy but there was no spice at all. It was pretty good, nothing to complain about but nothing unbelievable. The garlic cheese naan was hands down the best part of the meal.  For the main dish, rice, and naan it was 13 pounds after the 20% student discount. I enjoyed the service and the food was pretty good. I bet I will be back a couple times in the next few months.

se-eOx-XROPgg-tSEVeZvA.text: The food was amazing. The price was reasonable for London. We had Great service.I definitely recommend it!

mnHvhNW4z4Q58FcIwx3w3w.text: Place is small, food is average at best, service is fishy. We wanted to try a few items so we ordered the lamb biryani, naans, and mixed vegetable curry. Here is where the service starts to get shadey. The lamb biryani comes with a side dish of the SAME exact mixed vegetable curry that we ordered, so why couldn't the waiter point that fact out and ask us if this is indeed what we want to order because it's just double of what we have coming? It doesn't hurt to make sure by asking us! What drove the fishy night further is the tipping part. The bill reads s/c, to which the waiter said it's "service charge" and insists it's not a tip. He basically stood over us with the machine, and waited for us to punch in an additional tip amount. This is despicable. I don't recommend coming here unless you feel the need to be generous and donate to the so-called needy.

Hw290pdGip191-_7ix150g.text: The food was amazing, and we loved it - it is all made fresh to order and gluten free was no problem.   The butter chicken was a bit spicy for my kids, but they offered to make it more mild if we wanted and brought us some raita and lots of water which made everyone happy. The service is fast and friendly.   They offered to make my daughter some buttered chicken in five minutes!  The waiters are always around in case you have a problem. The location was perfect, it was not too quiet nor too loud, and the music was not played very loudly, so we were able to talk. The restaurant was beautifully decorated, as well. Finally, the bathrooms were very clean which was nice! Overall hands down the best Indian food we've had - and we have had a lot coming from the California Bay Area.

fJkjs3iXlQwgj5PNhTrM4w.text: The waiter of this family owned restaurant was extremely charming and sincere about ensuring that our meal/dining experience was exceptional ... and it was!Reasonable prices were an added bonus

l0oE3Llj_EBsOnPQg5eK-A.text: Excellent food, really nice service. I would definitely recommend it for a traditional Indian diner.

fszIltetwZWeOzHMFvcirA.text: Wow! Amazing food, amazing service, even stayed open late for us! I went with friends back on 9/5/17 and had held onto the business card because I was dead set on writing a review for these guys. What a delight to be here. The food was unforgettable and cant wait to go back. So much flavor and the service, I cant say enough about the service. Shook our hands and made some great menu suggestions and even whipped up some special treats for us. I also have to say I did have a chance to dine on the so called "worlds greatest Indian Food" on Brick land and that was less than 1 star compared to the Rajdoot. I was so disgusted with Brick Lane restaurants and this was such a relief from the gimmicky sales pitches of BL. Really need to go back to Rajdoot next time I am in London. We loved it!! Thank you! :) - 50 years!

bypDHGGkQCTWEHaF5sGXuw.text: This is hands down the most amazing Indian restaurant in the city! Amazing service, they truly care for you. The food is incredible. The chicken tikka Masala is hands down the best in the city. Amazing wine prices. Sitting in the patio was a delight. Will be coming back!

sqXxh5-SdT9yLiNOtOxhXw.text: We were in London 2 weeks ago, & we ate here twice.  I'd rate our first visit 5 stars.  We ate upstairs, & our server was Ali, the brother of the owner.  He was outstanding in his attentiveness, & the food was outstanding - the best we had in London.  Later in the week, we ate downstairs as the upstairs was full.  I'd rate this visit 3 stars.  Although the food was again excellent, it took 4 requests & two servers (none were Ali) to bring water.  The chicken mango dish had no mango.  We asked the server & he said it was pureed into the sauce; however, it was not like that the first night we ate there when we had large slices of mango with the chicken.  Also, the 2nd server clanged about setting the table next to us (1 foot away) while we ate, even though the table wasn't needed any more for the night; they also charged us (double) for a simple appetizer.  The food is excellent, but if you eat here, ask for Ali!

OmZJTb0WwzY0einQcpE3Yw.text: In Marylebone for the weekend, this place was just around the corner. Cozy little casual place, excellent food and the service was very friendly! Seems like they have plenty of regulars, had wonderful conversation with two gentleman that visit often. Thanks for making our last dinner in London a memorable one!

wodR5voS4XlKV_8XqHQXjQ.text: Excellent service from a friendly host. Really appreciatied the flexibility in dishes and the variety.

a0EPzHKjCpULC_tzsqJasQ.text: I've never enjoyed an Indian place as much as Rajdoot. The food is amazing and you will find some original recipes here by the chef... and they're all great. Seriously, you could just point at the menu blindfolded and you'd have a great meal.Any dish with lamb tikka in it is especially amazing, and they have the best saag paneer I've ever tasted. The Rajasthani Paneer is sublime. The staff will remember you after one or two visits and will be so happy to see you even if you are just walking past.

uOdQ1C85GOgvsFFhcOhSvw.text: Last week I was tasked with finding a restaurant for 8 on short notice. I fired up the Yelp and The Rajdoot took us and didn't bat an eye when 8 became 10. Some had never had Indian food and some were more familiar. There were things on the menu I had never seen and I love the food. I had the chicken tikka malowa which is similar to it's masala cousin except with a coconut milk base. That's what I'm getting next time.Everyone raved about their dishes, some talking about it days later.

vfsDfnaXdkjzt0X7sK32CQ.text: The Good: Loved the peshawari naan and rajasthanj paneer. This is must go for Indian food lover.Daal makhani was slightly on the sweeter sideBut it was tasty.The bad: The space is cramped and the quantity was less for the daal given that was a main dishChapati and naan were decent sized. We ordered 2 naans and 2 chapai amongst 3 with rice and had to overeat a little bit to finish everything so decide.

EMZB_7LRRqmdOf8iB5tK3g.text: My favorite meal since I moved to London!  Absolutely delicious food with tons of options, all of which looked amazing... Really incredible service and an all around top notch experience - hate to suggest it because I don't want a longer wait, but highly recommend!!!

ZhMDWKa_tVt_R4-g1cwHyA.text: Great food everything was nicely prepared! Amazing staff, family business and the brothers were very friendly. Definitely would come back. Being opened til midnight is a big plus!

UzlTkWHqjdt4naA2OP4Mgw.text: Food was good.  Best part of meal was chutney and papadum.  Ordered special chicken tikka masala -too sweet for my taste but made with coconut milk, so not surprised.  Ordered lobster and it was tough and it was not deveined, so kind of grossed me out.  Waitstaff was incredibly friendly, but disorganized.  We waited an eternity for our bill.

3hHTV-ndpqHT74DX6t6_5w.text: Good Indian food, typical style, very good food and service. They have both Cobra and Kingfisher on draught, which is rare. I had the Chicken Jalfrezi, well spiced and very fresh. Garlic Naan was good as was the Pillau rice. Also had several starters, Samosas, Onion Bhajis and they were good as well. Good choice if you're local.

6h38wOt4tmbmvELBPEYFGw.text: Excellent place to eat! The food is phenomenal and the staff is very friendly. The Radjoot has exceptional customer service - honestly the best I've had so far in London. I would highly recommend and will definitely be back the next time I'm in town!

Nt9gKvASBZp9qRQ3SVAj1w.text: I came here with my family a week ago and was floored by the quality of the food and the friendly service. After a great experience I had to bring my girlfriend when she was visiting me. I was recognized upon entering and received the same excellent service and the same excellent food. The food ranks remains the best Indian food I have had. I cannot recommend it enough. Great food and an even better experience.

aaFP0E1My4TfLApO4tvLyQ.text: Family run restaurant for 53 years, the Rajdoot is a place that is truly friendly and genuinely cares about the customer. The freshly made naan was amazing, the spinach and chicken Tikka masala outstanding. The owner and the servers even went as far as making sure the restaurant temperature was just right. Highly recommended.

HwqnJvtUSbuXpro-5GC8rg.text: Stop reading this review, call yourself an UBER, and get to The Rajdoot.  This is the best Indian food in London.  We had the signature dish paired with the coconut rice... something sweet with just the right amount of spice.  The chicken was cooked to perfection and the quality of the meat was superb.This place has been around for 54 years and is run by the third generation to take the reins. The service was fantastic.I come to London around 4 times a year so it will take me a few years to have everything on the menu... but I'll be working on it.

VRjPcFt8AElYcOhoma09RQ.text: Excellent service friendly service by AliThe manager was super welcoming outside tooFood was fabulous!!! Thank you for a great experience on a summer rainy day!

J2boZYjCIp_2iTQ0IcJhlw.text: Ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala here, and loved it! The chicken was tender, and the flavour was really great. The naan was also soft, and the rice was well done. At the end, when you pay, they will also give you really great tasting chocolates!!Would definitely come back!!

8q2UODM2T-IsYesf4-oXeA.text: Had a busy day of business and were pleasantly surprised to pass Paddington Park to find The Rajdoot. We'd been impressed with the culinary diversity in the city and have been jonesing for some naan and Indian curries. Upon entering Hussain took amazing care of us... rather than ordering we asked him to bring us his favorite dishes... needless to say he knocked it out of the park. The location (next to the park), the simple open window ambience is quaint yet the food stole the show. Enjoy

4NSf424kWOEAG5ZU38SBKQ.text: I was there with a friend about a week ago and we had an amazing experience. The staff was so friendly and got a chance to talk to 2 of the 4 brothers who own the place. This was my first time having Indian food outside the US and had heard it's a must try in London. We were not disappointed, it was probably the best Indian food I've ever had. The only downside to this establishment is that it's 5000 miles away from where I live - wish I could go all the time. If I'm ever in London I will be back!

t16pKVSM02ZGNXbnAdSW6w.text: We came here after a stroll in Regent's Park and had a terrific, vegetarian lunch.  We came at noon and were practically the only ones in the restaurant.  We drank a local beer and it was good - lighter which I liked.  The menu has many meat and vegetarian options so it's hard to imagine you wouldn't find something you like.  We really enjoyed the garlic naan, sag paneer and a cauliflower dish whose name I cannot now recall.  We went away stuffed and happy.I would come here again, definitely.

uIqsFqmThchLrkKmFNqHCQ.text: Good Indian food and excellent service, friendly services from all! Thanks a lot to the manager for your warm welcome.

Uf-4J14j-Jb1JHsE71SF8Q.text: I was recommended this place by a friend and it didn't disappoint nor wow. As a warning, space is quite small and waiters and other patrons are always jostling in the very narrow aisles between tables, especially between tables. At one point, someone swept utensil (and thankfully not food) off our table as they tried their best to squeezePortions are moderately sized but moderate is all you need for heavy Indian food. The chicken tikka masala is much less creamy than I'm used to, but the chicken was very tender. We also ordered tarka daal which I personally don't love, but my dinner companion seemed to appreciate. Highlight was the garlic naan which was well seasoned and perfectly pillowy at the edges. Unfortunately, I felt that the food we ordered lacked depth of flavor compared to my expectations of Indian food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. pilau rice
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. chicken tikka masala on the left; tarka daal side on the right
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. one garlic naan

XoqLx4X7FQDbXW5wupy9Sg.text: Awesome Indian food. Great location and amazing service. Chicken Tikka masala and dal were too good. We will definitely come back.

MM6DLZ7WQF0zvTBak1h7Yw.text: Phenomenal food, friendly staff, and great service!  Best Indian food I've had in a long time, and great menu.  Chicken Bhuna was absolutely delicious, as was the garlic naan.  Definitely recommend!

NYBzKzTodrhn1uYiul7Crw.text: Yummy food and wonderful service. Late night and delicious.  Happy we found this place!

dGT9heVMu5iw9MstygOImA.text: Excellent food.  Best food we've had in London so far.  Favorite dishes were Naga chicken (medium was equivalent of spicy to our American taste buds), butter chicken, and Cauliflower Bhaji.  And the Brinjal bhaji was outstanding.  Waiter Hussain was attentive.

H6hAev7u7hZoJbgQnSxPVg.text: Amazing Indian food!!! Wow. Authentic and flavors are so strong. Def coming back. Hussain recommended the chicken and my friend the lamb and both were great. Get the garlic cheese naan! Quick, fresh, and filling food! Highly recommended and thank you hussain!!

GrbTdJWc1PafZcqvY6likQ.text: On our first evening in London my family and I were jet lagged and starving. Dining at the Rajdoot proved to be an experience capable of alleviating both of those woes. The restaurant is family owned, and the brother's running the operation were not only friendly, but incredibly capable servers who made sure we were ordering exactly the meal to sate our palates. The food was ready in a timely manner and everything was cooked to perfection. The dish for which they named their restaurant was definitely a treat: a mix of both chicken and lamb curried with a sweetness complimenting a potent blend of spices. And to round out the entire meal the chai is the perfect blend of spices and herbs presented in a tall and inviting glass. This was a great pick for our first meal in the city and we'll definitely be going again.

hhgka1fKSEYfzguDSHtE-A.text: I came here for dinner the other night and had a great experience. We made a reservation for a party of 7 people and were immediately taken downstairs to our table. My first impressions was that the restaurant was very presentable and that the staff were very friendly. My mom and I got there slightly earlier than everyone else in our party, so we started off with a bottle of wine and a couple of starters. They had a pretty nice selection of wines on their wine menu. We started off with the "cheese and garlic naan," which was excellent! However, I think they accidentally gave us just the plain garlic naan so I was a little bummed about that. Regardless, their naan was fantastic. We also all each ordered the "chutneys" (onion salad, pickle, mango chutney, & mint sauce) which came with their crispy flatbread. This was really cool to try. All of the chutneys were very interesting (and some a little spicy)! We also started with the tomato chom chom (fried crispy tomato stuffed with homemade cheese and minced meat). I highly recommend the tomato chom chom--great flavor, interesting, and delicious! It was done perfectly. For my entree, I ordered the "lamb tikka masala." I also split an order of rice with others at the table because it goes really well with it. The lamb tikka masala was also really good! I highly recommend it. The lamb was tender and flavorful and the dish wasn't overly salty. Overall, the service was very good. In fact, it was some of the best service that we have had while in London. The only thing that made us a little uncomfortable was the fact that the server was lingering very closely to us and watching us as we were figuring out how to split the bill amongst our party. We all felt a little rushed because of it. Other than that, everything was wonderful. Clean, nice restaurant, friendly staff, fair prices, good service, and great food! I highly recommend :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. Lamb tikka masala
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. Naan
Photo of The Rajdoot - London, United Kingdom. Tomato chom chom and garlic naan

f4QBTsNYsvlBc7yUOllXcg.text: Probably one of the best Indian restaurants I've been to! This place is family owned and has been operating for 54 years. The owners were so accommodating. We were not hungry from snacking all day but by the time it was 11pm, we wanted something to warm ourselves in this dreadful snowstorm. After calling the restaurant, they were willing to stay open a bit longer to serve us and the food was delicious! Everything was custom made with our requests... I'm not a big fan of lamb so they took it out of the rice dish I ordered. The spice level was perfect. The texture of the garlic nan was perfect dipping and eating with my aloo gobi and curries!

cL4Ozfcg3728Ay9KPKFh_A.text: The hot towel at the end of the night is what brought this review from a 4 to a 5. We ate dinner here based on yelp reviews- thank you yelpers!! This cute little corner restaurant has seating outside, inside, and downstairs. It is small. The staff was BEYOND kind, helpful, and catering. We had veggie curry, naan, masala, lamb, and chicken. The chicken masala was sweeter than expected, but overall very tasty. The veggie curry was good, but the lamb was dry and tough. We do highly recommend you eat here on your next visit to London.

0vEEOXncd0l2aH3R_bHeNQ.text: I had dinner at this Restaurant while visiting London! Great Food ! Don't go by outlook of the restaurant. Inside it is quite clean with friendly staff and awesome food.

rfcSzooeMwr3elPV_ebfpA.text: A friend who lived in London for a decade recommended this as one of his favorite Indian places in the city, and it did not disappoint. My family and I are here in the night before we were flying back to the States. The service was jaw-droppingly good. I was sort of amazed that they still put so much effort in after having been around since 1964. You can tell that the brothers who run it really take it seriously as a family business. It was so friendly, and they were even great with kids. The food was fantastic, and I ate far more than I reasonably should have. Highly recommended!

c-z2W2IWd7xfCqRZ9eqYlw.text: Stumbled upon this place while looking around nearby bookshops, and glad I did. Better than any Indian food I've had in recent years out in the US, reasonably priced, lots of delicate, complex and interesting flavor. The staff are extremely attentive and accommodating, looking forward to it the next time I am in London.
